works.description:
THE TEXT WAS COPIED FROM TWO OF OUR FAQ’S:  
What's the difference between a procedure and a work instruction? And What  
should our procedures and work instructions look like?
THE TEXT COPIED FROM OUR SITE IS: "A procedure describes how a process is  
performed, while a work instruction describes how a task is performed. Work  
instructions tend to be more detailed than procedures. Procedures can take  
the form of a narrative, a flow chart, a process map, or any other suitable  
form. Work instructions can also take any suitable form. However, one of  
the best ways to document a work instruction is to use a form. Forms are  
particularly useful because they become records once they're filled in."
